definition: name/noun (part of speech)/place (e.g. among winners)/famous/classifier for people
full moon/to hope/to expect/to visit/to gaze (into the distance)/to look towards/towards

sentences.english: Actually, Paris is the most miserable with reputation damaged.
sentences.chinese: 事實上，最慘的仍是巴黎，剎時名望受損。

sentences.english: The kind of fame that hounded Pollock's life and death never quite came to Still.
sentences.chinese: 圍繞波洛克生與死的那種名望從未降臨到史蒂爾身上。

sentences.english: We are well-known in trade circles, and respect our clients.
sentences.chinese: 我們在貿易界很有名望，並且尊重我們的客戶。

sentences.english: He that soweth virtue shall reap fame.
sentences.chinese: 播下美好的品德，收成名望。

sentences.english: She swore to avenge herself on them for the insult that had been offered to her name and reputation.
sentences.chinese: 她發誓爲侮辱她的名望和聲譽向他們進行報復。

sentences.english: Greece has, of course, been producing wines for thousands of years, but in more recent times its reputation has sunk low with the incorrect assumption that all roads lead to retsina.
sentences.chinese: 希臘釀酒歷史悠久，但在近代史中名望較低。

sentences.english: Her popularity declined after 1990's and be retired.
sentences.chinese: 20世紀90年代之後她的名望下降並退休了。
他們在貿易界很有名望。

sentences.english: Fame spurs us to pursue the abstinent life of the poet.
sentences.chinese: 對名望的追求讓我們過詩人清心寡慾的生活。

sentences.english: Fame usually comes to those who are thinking something else. ---O. W. Holmes.
sentences.chinese: 名望通常出現在那些思考一些事情的人身上。

sentences.english: He owed his fame to good fortune.
sentences.chinese: 他把他獲得的名望歸因於好運。

sentences.english: They are not well-knowingingn in trade circles.
sentences.chinese: 她們在貿易界很有名望。

sentences.english: No wonder you're such a renowned diagnostician.
sentences.chinese: 難怪你是個那麼有名望的診斷專家。

sentences.english: Now fame, it is fleeting, and stars, they keep falling.
sentences.chinese: 你知道，名望是短暫的，而星星們也不斷殞落。

sentences.english: But fame increasingly consists in a state of almost constant near-collapse.
sentences.chinese: 不過名望也越來越多地伴隨着一種近乎崩潰的狀態。

sentences.english: The endorsement of international collectors with powerful reputations is also essential.
sentences.chinese: 得到高名望的國際收藏家的認可也十分有必要。

definition: a person of virtue and prestige/a person of good moral standing and reputation
an official position/a job in the bureaucracy
order of feudal nobility, namely: Duke 公[gong1], Marquis 侯[hou2], Count 伯[bo2], Viscount 子[zi3], Baron 男[nan2]
